message_1: In a group of 8 friends, how many ways can 4 of them be chosen to form a committee?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to choose 4 friends out of 8 to form a committee, we can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of friends (8) and k is the number of friends to be chosen (4).

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!(8-4)!)

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!4!)

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((4 × 3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5) / (4 × 3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 4) = 1680 / 24

C(8, 4) = 70

So, there are 70 ways to choose 4 friends out of 8 to form a committee.
